summary: In this "GAOverview," we discuss types of waste in federal programs and strategies to address it. Waste is when individuals or organizations spend government resources carelessly, extravagantly, or without purpose. Federal programs may be vulnerable to waste for a number of reasons, including asset mismanagement. title: GAOverview: Understanding Waste in Federal Programs
